images.copyright: Sipapu Bridge in Natural Bridges National Monument, Utah (© Fyletto/Getty Images)
images.title: Bridges to the past
images.caption: Bridges to the past
images.desc: The story of this striking sandstone formation in the US state of Utah begins around 10 million years ago. That's when tectonic shifts began slowly lifting the 336,000 square-kilometre Colorado Plateau above the surrounding plains. Later the Colorado River's many streams cut through the elevated land, threading it with deep canyons. When water broke through one canyon wall into another canyon, sometimes a natural bridge like this one remained above the gap.
